title: Economic Impact of Remittance Tax on Central America
summary: Analysis of how proposed remittance taxes would affect Guatemala and other Central American economies.
body:
# Economic Impact of Remittance Tax on Central America

## Executive Summary

This report analyzes the potential economic impact of proposed remittance taxes on Central American economies, with a particular focus on Guatemala. Our findings indicate that such taxes would significantly reduce remittance flows, negatively affecting household incomes, consumption, and overall economic stability in the region.

## Key Findings

- Remittances constitute over 15% of Guatemala's GDP
- A proposed 10% tax would reduce remittance flows by an estimated 12-18%
- Household consumption could decrease by 3-5% nationwide
- Rural communities would be disproportionately affected

## Policy Implications

Policymakers should consider these economic impacts when evaluating remittance tax proposals, as the negative effects on Central American economies could potentially increase migration pressures rather than reduce them.
